Document.HeaderText: PDF Rendering with iText - a case study

Contents.Heading: Chapter 1 - Introduction
Contents.SimpleText: iText PDF is a OpenSource library that was originally written in Java, but was later on ported to C#.NET, too. It is quite a powerful collection of functionalities to manipulate and dynamically generate PDF files.
Contents.Heading: 1.1 Basic basic building blocks
Contents.SimpleText: Basic building blocks, that allow PDF creation on high abstraction level without deeper knowledge of the internal PDF structure are the following:

List.ListItem: Element: The most abstract document content.
Phrase: Consists of Chunks - allows simple alignment.
Section: Allows nested numbering of section / chapter headings.
Chapter: Allows nested numbering of chapter headings.

Contents.Heading: 1.1.1 Element
Contents.SimpleText: The most abstract PDF document content. Only defines an interface, which all basic building blocks implement.
Contents.Heading: 1.1.2 Chunk
Contents.SimpleText: The most atomic PDF document - represents simple String pieces with a certain fontname.
